segments.text: I see the adult woman drying dishes, her focus so singular it's almost concerning.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is rising in the sink, no one seems to care, and that makes me feel uneasy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There's a calmness outside in the garden that sharply contrasts with the chaos here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is almost stretching out of my line of sight, reaching for those cookies like it’s the most important thing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about how the children are breaking a rule and it makes me feel a bit frustrated.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like they’re living in their own little world, unaware of the mess they're creating.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout out, to warn them, but I feel frozen in place, an observer to this mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s expectant look makes me think about childhood innocence, yet it feels like a set-up for trouble.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but wonder, will they learn from this moment, or will it be brushed off as just another day?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels charged, like the calm before a storm that no one else sees coming.
segments.speaker: PAR
